front.title: Extensions for the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol for IPv6

abstract.t: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol for IPv6 [4] (DHCP) provides a framework for passing configuration information to hosts on a TCP/IP network. Configuration parameters and other control information are carried in typed data items that are stored in the 'extensions' field of the DHCP message. The data items themselves are also called 'extensions.' This document specifies the initial set of DHCP extensions, which will be periodically updated as new extensions are defined until this document reaches proposed standard.
